meanings.definition: Suffer deterioration after a period of improvement.
meanings.sent1: After feeling better, he began to relapse and feel worse again.
meanings.sent2: She was doing well in her recovery, but then she relapsed and had to start over.
meanings.sent3: The plant seemed to relapse into wilting every time it was watered.
meanings.sent4: His progress in the game started to relapse, and he found himself struggling again.
meanings.sent5: The old car's engine would often relapse into sputtering and stalling unexpectedly.
